alternative_parents.description: Alcohols substituted by a bromine atom at a saturated carbon atom otherwise bearing only hydrogen or hydrocarbyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Bromohydrins

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds comprising the oxoazanium cation, with the formula N+=O.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxoazanium compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organobromides

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl bromide functional group with formula R-Br, where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl bromides

class.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X=Y+-Z- <-> X--Y+=Z<-> X+-Y-Z-<-> X-=Y-Z+ (X, Z = C, N, or O; Y = N or O).
class.name: Allyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as c-nitro compounds. These are compounds having the nitro group, -NO2 (free valence on nitrogen), which is attached to carbon.

direct_parent.description: Compounds having the nitro group, -NO2 (free valence on nitrogen), which is attached to carbon.
direct_parent.name: C-nitro compounds

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds having the nitro group, -NO2 (free valence on nitrogen), which may be attached to carbon, nitrogen (as in nitramines), or oxygen (as in nitrates), among other elements (in the absence of specification, C-nitro compounds are usually implied).
subclass.name: Organic nitro compounds

superclass.description: Electrically neutral organic molecules carrying a positive and a negative charge in one of their major canonical descriptions. In most dipolar compounds the charges are delocalized; however the term is also applied to species where this is not the case. The term 1,3-dipolar compounds is used for those in which a significant canonical resonance form can be represented by a separation of charge over three atoms (in connection with 1,3-dipolar cycloadditions).
superclass.name: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds
